verses.verse: Now there was a great<WH1419> outcry<WH6818> of the people<WH5971> and of their wives<WH802> against<WH413> their Jewish<WH3064> brothers.<WH251>

For there<WH3426> were those who<WH834> said,<WH559> "We, our sons<WH1121> and our daughters,<WH1323> are many;<WH7227> therefore let us get<WH3947> grain<WH1715> that we may eat<WH398> and live.<WH2421>"

And there<WH3426> were others who<WH834> said,<WH559> "We are mortgaging<WH6148> our fields,<WH7704> our vineyards,<WH3754> and our houses<WH1004> that we might get<WH3947> grain<WH1715> because of the famine.<WH7458>"
Also there<WH3426> were those who<WH834> said,<WH559> "We have borrowed<WH9233> money<WH3701> for the king's tax<WH9246> [on] our fields<WH7704> and our vineyards.<WH3754>

"And now<WH6258> our flesh<WH1320> is like the flesh<WH1320> of our brothers,<WH251> our children<WH1121> like their children.<WH1121> Yet behold,<WH2009> we are forcing<WH3533> our sons<WH1121> and our daughters<WH1323> to be slaves,<WH5650> and some<WH4480> of our daughters<WH1323> are forced<WH3533> into bondage<WH3533> [already,] and we are helpless<WH369> <WH410> <WH3027> because our fields<WH7704> and vineyards<WH3754> belong to others.<WH312>"
Then I was very<WH3966> angry<WH2734> when<WH9201> I had heard<WH8085> their outcry<WH2201> and these<WH428> words.<WH1697>

And I consulted<WH9265> with myself, and contended<WH7378> with the nobles<WH2715> and the rulers<WH5461> and said<WH559> to them, "You are exacting<WH5377> usury,<WH4855> each<WH376> from his brother!<WH251>" Therefore, I held<WH5414> a great<WH1419> assembly<WH6952> against<WH5921> them.

And I said<WH559> to them, "We according to our ability<WH1767> have redeemed<WH7069> our Jewish<WH3064> brothers<WH251> who were sold<WH4376> to the nations;<WH1471> now would you even<WH1571> sell<WH4376> your brothers<WH251> that they may be sold<WH4376> to us?" Then they were silent<WH2790> and could not find<WH4672> a word<WH1697> [to say.]

Again I said,<WH559> "The thing<WH1697> which<WH834> you are doing<WH6213> is not good;<WH2896> should you not walk<WH1980> in the fear<WH3374> of our God<WH430> because<WH4480> of the reproach<WH2781> of the nations,<WH1471> our enemies<WH340>?
"And likewise<WH1571> I, my brothers<WH251> and my servants,<WH5288> are lending<WH5383> them money<WH3701> and grain.<WH1715> Please,<WH4994> let us leave<WH5800> off this<WH2088> usury.<WH4855>

"Please,<WH4994> give<WH7725> back<WH7725> to them this very day<WH3117> their fields,<WH7704> their vineyards,<WH3754> their olive<WH2132> groves,<WH2132> and their houses,<WH1004> also the hundredth<WH3967> [part] of the money<WH3701> and of the grain,<WH1715> the new<WH8492> wine,<WH8492> and the oil<WH3323> that you are exacting<WH5383> from them."

Then they said,<WH559> "We will give<WH7725> [it] back<WH7725> and will require<WH1245> nothing<WH3808> from them; we will do<WH6213> exactly<WH3651> as you say.<WH559>" So I called<WH7121> the priests<WH3548> and took<WH7650> an oath<WH7650> from them that they would do<WH6213> according to this<WH2088> promise.<WH1697>

I also<WH1571> shook<WH5287> out the front<WH2684> of my garment<WH2684> and said,<WH559> "Thus<WH3602> may God<WH430> shake<WH5287> out every<WH3605> man<WH376> from his house<WH1004> and from his possessions<WH3018> who<WH834> does not fulfill<WH6965> this<WH2088> promise;<WH1697> even thus<WH3602> may he be shaken<WH5287> out and emptied.<WH7386>" And all<WH3605> the assembly<WH6951> said,<WH559> "Amen!<WH543>" And they praised<WH1984> the Lord.<WH3068> Then the people<WH5971> did<WH6213> according to this<WH2088> promise.<WH1697>

Moreover,<WH1571> from the day<WH3117> that I was appointed<WH6680> to be their governor<WH6346> in the land<WH776> of Judah,<WH3063> from the twentieth<WH6242> year<WH8141> to the thirty-second year<WH8141> of King<WH4428> Artaxerxes,<WH783> [for] twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> years,<WH8141> neither<WH3808> I nor<WH3808> my kinsmen<WH251> have eaten<WH398> the governor's food<WH3899> [allowance.]

But the former<WH7223> governors<WH6346> who<WH834> were before<WH6440> me laid<WH3513> burdens<WH3513> on the people<WH5971> and took<WH3947> from them bread<WH3899> and wine<WH3196> besides<WH310> forty<WH705> shekels<WH8255> of silver;<WH3701> even<WH1571> their servants<WH5288> domineered<WH7980> the people.<WH5971> But I did not do<WH6213> so<WH3651> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of the fear<WH3374> of God.<WH430>

And I also<WH1571> applied<WH2388> myself to the work<WH4399> on this<WH2088> wall;<WH2346> we did not buy<WH7069> any land,<WH7704> and all<WH3605> my servants<WH5288> were gathered<WH6908> there<WH8033> for the work.<WH4399>

Moreover, [there were] at my table<WH7979> one hundred<WH3967> and fifty<WH2572> Jews<WH3064> and officials,<WH5461> besides those who came<WH935> to us from the nations<WH1471> that were around<WH5439> us.

Now that which<WH834> was prepared<WH6213> for each day<WH3117> was one<WH259> ox<WH7794> [and] six<WH8337> choice<WH1305> sheep,<WH6629> also birds<WH6833> were prepared<WH6213> for me; and once<WH996> in ten<WH6235> days<WH3117> all<WH3605> sorts of wine<WH3196> [were furnished] in abundance.<WH7235> Yet for all this<WH2088> I did not demand<WH1245> the governor's food<WH3899> [allowance,] because<WH3588> the servitude<WH5656> was heavy<WH3513> on this<WH2088> people.<WH5971>
Remember<WH2142> me, O my God,<WH430> for good,<WH9186> [according to] all<WH3605> that I have done<WH6213> for this<WH2088> people.<WH5971>
